subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: Box user concerns.
author: Lisby
full_text:
Bozo ex-VP?

Huh?

On Nov 27, 2007, at 7:35 PM, erick hunter wrote:

> If you want to talk about collateral damage to friends and family,   
> have you seriously considered Hollywoods' offerings of late?  How  
> about the bozo ex-VP?  Anybody for a Muslim US president?  These  
> are concerns.  The boxes are research,  just like any other.         
> --Rod
>
> babiarz3 <babiarz3@...> wrote:
>
> I guess that's all that matters. Because I'm sure that groups will not
> pool their 10 bucks a piece together, get a box, head into someones
> home.... and who knows.
>
> Okay, I'm done. My opinions are clear. But, we all know about  
> opinions...
>
> --- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, Lisby <lisby@...> wrote:
> >
> > I also meant to add that this mini-box is hardly going into mass
> > production. If you want one, you have to cough up $400-$500, just
> > like I just did. That fee alone is enough to deter casual users. The
> > people who buy these are not going to buy them on a whim.
> >
> > Ann
> >
> > On Nov 24, 2007, at 12:07 AM, Frank Sumption wrote:
> >
> > > It's not that concerns are not considered, I think no one knows
> > > what to do with it. There's not enough box users, and ITC
> > > researchers out there to really good feel for what the pitfalls
> > > are. So far after seven years of EVP/ITC work I can say onlly that
> > > these dark entities, or wahtever it is talk bad, and threaten, and
> > > that's about all they do. They threaten, I tell them to bring it,
> > > and....nothin'! Paper tigers I say.
> > >
> > > As far as some fears that portals are opened, and all kinds of
> > > evil comes in, I don't believe that either. They are already have
> > > full access, they already exist in more demensions, making this
> > > physical level about the lowest level of spiritual existence/
> > > evolution. Just about all these worries are old fear crap to keep
> > > people in church.
> > >
> > > I don't think it's fair to with hold the stuff cuz of a few nut
> > > jobs, you have the same problem with everything from bicycles to
> > > airplanes.
> > >
> > > I had that concern about selling my boxes, but how would you
> > > screen users? You can't. Not everyone can use a quija board, and
> > > not too many unbalanced ding dongs get in trouble with those  
> anyway.
> > >
> > > Frank-S
> > >
> > >
> > >
> > > To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com
> > > From: babiarz3@...
> > > Date: Fri, 23 Nov 2007 19:58:45 +0000
> > > Subject: [EVP-ITC] Re: Family hour around the radio
> > >
> > > I am a fairly quiet person, most of the time. I have my  
> thoughts and
> > > opinions on topics but feel strongly about "to each his own".  
> Unless
> > > something strikes me as completely wrong, I won't debate. No  
> one here
> > > has heard from me other than recently with this mini-box yet, I am
> > > here several times weekly reading and offering my energy in  
> support of
> > > the research.
> > > However...something is striking me here and again, I can't keep my
> > > mouth shut. The discussion about the family hour with the box  
> has led
> > > the way for people to mention negativity and even "the dark  
> guys" can
> > > be fun if not taken seriously.
> > > I ask you to consider the fact that many who purchase the mini-box
> > > will not be of the right frame of mind. Most will not be in  
> harmony.
> > > Many will take "the dark guys" seriously. Yet, you feel it's a  
> good
> > > idea to let anyone who wants a box have one? All in the name of
> > > sharing technology.
> > > I know that my previous posts expressing my concern over the mass
> > > marketing of the box, was barely given consideration. Realize  
> that I
> > > am not being selfish- I do not own a box. EVP is my passion and  
> has
> > > been from day one 6 years ago when I jumped fully into the  
> field. I am
> > > successful in capturing EVP, always have been. I still do it  
> the "old
> > > fashioned way" with open air techniques. Would I love to be  
> able to
> > > hold real time 2 way communications with the other side? Of  
> course.
> > > However, I do not think enough research into the possibilities has
> > > been done to warrant the approval let alone production of these  
> boxes.
> > > Those of us who have been on countless investigations with many  
> people
> > > will quickly admit that there are some people we'd rather not
> > > investigate with. When they are present, negative things tend to
> > > happen. We all know one or two people who we can say "felt  
> dark" from
> > > the first meeting. We all admit that being mentally sound is an
> > > important quality in this field. If you have mental issues,  
> this may
> > > not be the area of research for you. We don't bring children on
> > > investigations for obvious reasons. BUT! If you want a box that  
> could
> > > possibly open up a portal and bridge the gap between here and the
> > > dark, sure! Anyone who wants one should have it!
> > > You might feel that I am over reacting or being overly dramatic.
> > > That's fine. My concern is not what you think of me but that you
> > > consider the possibilities here. Many of which we do not know.  
> Can you
> > > be 100% sure that this is a good idea or that it's worthy of  
> saying
> > > "well, we'll see what happens"?
> > >
> > > --- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, bruce halliday
> > > <paranormalinvestigating@> wrote:
> > > >
> > > > Bill,
> > > >
> > > > You have the right idea, I recently have dealt with a lot
> > > > of negativity from my Frank's box. Harmony is very important
> > > > as is the right frame of mind before turning the box on.
> > > >
> > > > hope you & the family had a good holiday.
> > > >
> > > > Bruce
> > > >
> > > > Bruce Halliday Paranormal Investigating Team
> > > >
> > > >
> > > > To: EVP-ITC@: vilhellm@: Fri, 23 Nov 2007 02:46:20
> > > +0000Subject: [EVP-ITC] Family hour around the radio
> > > >
> > > >
> > > >
> > > >
> > > > Maybe we're just a little unconventional in our household,  
> but most
> > > of us here are pretty open to the idea of the multiverse.  
> Gathering in
> > > a circle around our Frank's Box is our idea of quality family  
> time.
> > > The messages are relevent, the interest is high, and we're very  
> well
> > > grounded and do not let the tricksters push us around.Happy
> > > Thanksgiving from our home to yours. -Bill
> > > >
> > > >
> > > >
> > > >
> > > >
> > > >

> > > >
> > > http://www.windowslive.com/connect.html?
> > > ocid=TXT_TAGLM_Wave2_newways_112007
> > > >
> > >
> > >
> > >
> > > Your smile counts. The more smiles you share, the more we donate.
> > > Join in!
> > >
> > >
> >
>
>
>
>
